answers.answer: HiI am Faisal from Pakistan, i am diabetic for the last 18 years i'm now 37 years old, mine creatinine elevated to 6.7 3 months back but with treatment mine creatinine is now 2.7.regards,00923004481100

HiMy mother had Diabitis for more than 14 years and she had same issues. She started her Dialysis from January 03. Well Creatinine Level 2.9 is more but still you can control with proper Diet. Best chance is to talk to Dietitian and plan her daily food guide. I am sure with strict diet restriction (she can not have certain fruit - vegetables etc ) she can maintain the good creatinine level.

i went toxic on lithium  my creatine went up  but came down...then i had a general chemistry it wa only uop 1 point 1.3..when you get toi 2.0  and the (GFR) IS BELOW 59  THEN IT'S TIME TO SE A SPECIALIST...THE GFR IS VERY IMPORTANT AS ITH THE CREATINE...ALSO THE BUN CREATININE AND  RATIO  SHOULD BE TESTED..I THINK AS LONG AS THESE ARE WORKING THE THING WITH DIALYSIS IS WHEN THE GFR  IS OUT OF WHACK..LIKE 55  OR LESS..THE CRETIUNE IS THE KINDEY FUNSHION..AND THE GFR IS THE FILTERING PROCESS,,THIS IS IF THIS GETS TO LOW THEN YOU NEESD OF DIALYSIS....BLOOD P IS THE MAIN CAUSE OF THE CRENTINE  TEN SUGAR...BUT BOTH IS  NOT GOOD..THATS WHY YA NEED TO KEEP THE SUGAR AT BAY..

Hi,My FATHER, 65 years, has been suffering from Diabetes for over 20 years. Recently, she took her blood tests and found that her Creatinine level has shot up to 2.9What I wanted to know was:1) Can this creatinine level be brought down?2) If not, can this be maintained?3) Is there a prescribed diet or exercise for this?4) Can she prevent the kidney from furtehr damage?5) At what level is dialysis required? Can this be avoided?Thanks,shafee_3539***@****

hi my father has got a high level of creatinine n it shot up to 8.11 it was effected due to some medication because hi didnt have nay kind of high creatinine before in his life ,so i want to know is their any solution to reverse this sudden increase of creatinine ??

Hi Vikram,Answer to your questions based on my knowledges:1) Can this creatinine level be brought down?Ans:  Yes, by haemodialysis therapy2) If not, can this be maintained?Ans:  It can be maintained by control and limit what we eat - protein, for example.3) Is there a prescribed diet or exercise for this?Ans:  Please talk to your mom’s doctor, each cases are different4) Can she prevent the kidney from further damage?Ans: Your mom kidney damaged from Diabetis, so it’s much more complicates case,since her creatinine still not too high, I belief doctor would tell your mom howto prevent further damage.5) At what level is dialysis required? Can this be avoided?Ans:  At the creatinine level 9-10 or the fifth stage (final end stage) is dialysis required !This is up to the patient’s decision if she/he wants to have haemodialysis, or fromthe family memeber’s!
my mother-in-laws creatinine is 2.1, pls suggest diet for her

Hi  so  sorry to  hear your mom  has  CKD.   Unfortunately  diabetes  leads  to  renal  failure  in most patients.Based on  your mom's the  creatinine  level  (2.9)    and  her  age,  she's  in  stage  4  or  GFR  17.    http://www.kidney.org/professionals/kdoqi/gfr_calculator.cfmOnly  way  to  reduce (a  tiny  bit)  creatinine is   with  dialysis,  but  even  with  dialysis  the  creatinine  will   remain high.   I've  been  on peritoneal  dialysis  for  over  6yrs  my  creatinine  usually  runs  in  the  6.5  or  higher.       Due  to   diabetes  damage on  kidneys  they  will not  improve however,  the  residual  function  your  mom  still has  can  be  maintained.The one  thing your  mom  can  do  is  reduce  her protein  intake,  watch her  phosphorus  levels   (dairy,  nuts,  beans,  soy, processed  foods)  and  also  keep  an  eye  on potassium   (oranges,  peaches,  melons,  avocado,  kiwi fruit  among  many  more  fruits  and  veggies).you might want to  visit   http://www.kidneyschool.org/mods/    to  learn  more  about  treatment options  as  well as  diet  to  follow  (minus  the   high  protein  kidney school  might  recommend)Take  care!

Hi  hirah,You  didn't  mention  which  type of  meds your dad  used.   Unfortunately  some  meds  do  damage the kidney  but  in those  cases  it's  referred  as  'acute  kidney  failure"  and in  most  cases  it's  reversible.I've  been  doing  peritoneal  dialysis  and  my  GFR   (kidney  function)  was  8  and  creatinine  6.5  at  the  start  of  the  med.   I  dropped  to  GFR 6  and  creatinine  7.2I  was  also  a  bit  dehydrated  at  the  time.  So  my  function  dropped  due to  all factors.But,  after  I  started  feeling  better  (infection gone)  and  also  started  drinking  more  water  and  added  a few  extra  dialysis  treatments here  and  there  and  my  function  jumped  back up  to  GFR 9  and  creatinine  5.7talk to your  father's  dr  to  see  what  the  next  plan of    action is.take  care!

has your  MIL  seen a dr   and  has he  suggested  seeing  a dietitian?A  dietitian  can  better  guide  her  on  the  diet. In  the meantime my  advice  would  be  to  cut  down  as  much  sodiumand  processed  foods  from her  diet.Also  keep an  eye  on potassium, phosphorus,  and protein.take  care!

Hi I'm 25 yrs old.  due to wrong medication my BP shot up, and so as my CREATININE level to 13 sept/2010. i had 15 dialysis. now after treatment its 5.1. i 'm not diabetic. i would suggest everyone that boil all vegges before u eat. not avoid potato, brinjal, fruit and oily food..  Exercise only when you feel well...  creatnine makes u weak.. so wait until u gain proper weight. and is there anything which i want to know then plz suggest....Tahir

hi am vinoth my age 57 is daibetic pateint 12 yr he is test the blood the creatinine level 2.0 and then next month its 1.5  is this is how to control normal and wheather its daiyalis ah please.....reply me yes its bp is 140-70

I younger brother will be 39 monday 4-25 and he has suffered with diabetes his entire life. He is blind,heart disease,kidney disease, diabetic neuropathy. He was taken to the hospital a wk ago his bloodsugar was 1100 and his creatine came back 10 which is failure he also was in diabectic ketoacidosis.After 3 days his creatine was brought to a 6.7 and his sugars remained in the 700's. I found out yesterday that he checked himself out of the hospital after agreeing to start dialysis the next day with his kidney dr. He loed to our entire family about everything, he told us he was discharged his Dr. informed us of al the above. He was told at home dialysis is not an option for him and he said he will not do. He told me Thursday that his bladder is full but he can only dribble when he urinates of course when I called his dr. he asked me to take him back to the hospital, my brother got mad at me for getting involved and he decided to take off with a friend for the weekend to an area called cedar key we are in jacksonville. his dr. said he is critical and needs to be in the hospital. I cannot get him to answer his cell phone he said he would call yesterday when he arrived. his dr. said if he makes it back that we need to call 911 or take him to the er. I know yesterday when he yelled his sugar was high, I know he is scared and tired of all the yrs of shots,sickness,pills and being blind and now this. He was told 2 yrs ago that he would need to start dialysis and now we are at this point. I do not know what to do, we lost our Mom 3yrs ago from congestive heart failure. My brother and I are so close we are only 14mths apart. I am so afraid that he went away so he could die. What should we do? If we call 911 he can refuse the trip, if we have him backer acted what would that do. He said he is ready to go home but his dr. said with dialysis he could live 2 more yrs or longer. Please any advise would help. I feel like I let him down by letting him leave like this. Thank for any advise

hello i recently went to the dentist and the dental hygenest asked me if i was sick i said i wasnt feeling well for the last several weeks and she said something was wrong with me every time she touched  my gums they would bleed she advised me to get some blood work done so i did because i had an apt w my doc next week for a hernia  my doc saw the blood work and was shocked he said my kidneys had shut down iwas at a loss my creatinine was 2.9 glucous 114 tryglycerides 1086 vldl 217 im on freak out mode now ive since had two more blood tests done and the numbers are coming back to normal but still high glucose 98 bun 15 cretinine1.1 gfr 76.6 does anyone know why this would happen. THANX STEVE

question: Hi,My mother, 60 years, has been suffering from Diabetes for over 15 years. She also has high BP. Recently, she took her blood tests and found that her Creatinine level has shot up to 2.9What I wanted to know was:1) Can this creatinine level be brought down?2) If not, can this be maintained?3) Is there a prescribed diet or exercise for this?4) Can she prevent the kidney from furtehr damage?5) At what level is dialysis required? Can this be avoided?Thanks,Vikram
title: How to control high creatinine levels
